column2: I\xc2\x92m glad you\xc2\x92re here, we have a couple of things to ask you\nabout the wedding ceremony.'
(starting to cry) Ohh\xc2\x85'
What\xc2\x92s the matter? You okay?'
Yeah, it\xc2\x92s just y\xc2\x92know\xc2\x85'
(To Ross) Monica said wedding.'
Uh, so anyway, we thought one of you could read something during the\nceremony.'
Oh! I would love to read a poem.'
Do you think you could get through a poem?'
(crying) It\xc2\x92ll be a short one.'
Okay, so Ross will be doing the reading.'
Ohhh\xc2\x85'
Okay. Yeah, I guess, I guess I could do that too.'
Too?'
Yeah, I kind of uh, have something else planned for you guys.'
Do you mind telling us what it is?'
Sorry, I\xc2\x92m kinda keeping this one on the Q.T.'
Well, whatever it is, I hope it involves winking. (Winks in a spy-type\nmanner.)'
(entering, excited) Hey!'
Hey!'
So I just talked to one of the DOOL writers today, and\xc2\x85'
What is DOOL?'
Days Of Our Lives. Anyway, you\xc2\x92re not gonna believe it! My\ncharacter is coming out of his coma!!'
Oh!!'
That\xc2\x92s great!'
And-and-and not only that, I\xc2\x92m gettin\xc2\x92 a new brain!!'
So great things are happening at work and in your personal\nlife!'
Wait, what do you mean you\xc2\x92re getting a new brain?'
Oh well, they\xc2\x92re killing off one of the characters on the show, and\nwhen she dies her brain is being transplanted into my body.'
What? A brain transplant?!'
(seriously) Yes, it\xc2\x92s a highly controversial procedure.'
It\xc2\x92s ridiculous!'
Well, I think it\xc2\x92s ridiculous that you haven\xc2\x92t had sex in three\nand a half months.'
(to Monica and Rachel) It\xc2\x92s winter, they are fewer people on the\nstreet. (Rachel and Monica smile and nod, knowingly.)'
Who are they killing off?'
Uh Cecilia Monroe, she plays Jessica Lockhart.'
Noo!!'
She\xc2\x92s my favorite character on DOOL.'
Nice.'
She is so good at throwing drinks in people\xc2\x92s faces, I mean I\ndon\xc2\x92t think I\xc2\x92ve ever seen her finish a beverage.'
And the way she slaps all the time!'
Oh!'
Wouldn\xc2\x92t you love to do it just once?! (Raises her hand towards\nChandler.)'
Don\xc2\x92t do it.'
Cecilia Monroe man, what a great actress.'
Oh, tell me about it. And she\xc2\x92s been on the show forever, it\xc2\x92s\ngonna be really hard to fill her shoes.'
Yeah-yeah, help me out here, when you come out of the "brain\ntransplant," you are going to be her?'
Yes, but in Drake Remoray\xc2\x92s body. (Ross laughs unbelievably.) Why is\nthis so hard for you to get? I thought you were a scientist!'
(Clears Throat) Rach, so, that guy there. Straight or gay?'
(They both look behind them.) Well, I'd have to say gay."
Yeah? Why?'
Well mainly because he's kissing that other guy."
Oh no not that guy there. That guy right there. (Pointing to an\nattractive man sitting at a table behind them.)'
Oh yeah he's too cute to be straight."
(A woman with large breasts walks in the door) Ohh knockers will help us\nfigure it out. (She walks by and he checks her out.)'
All right, straight, and not subtle. (The man gets up and leaves.)'
Ohh, he left his cell phone.'
Oh, well, we can hand it to Gunther and he'll put it in lost and found."
Or we could use it to call China. See how those guys are doing.'

What if, um, if he calls his own cell phone to find out who found it and\nI answer and we start talking and we fell in love. I mean wouldn't that be a great story?\nKind of like a fairy tale for the digital age."
Yeah\xc2\x85 That does sound great. I'm going to get the phone. (They both\nget up.)"
What? Wait! Why\xc2\x85why do you get the story?'
I don't know. I haven't been out on a date in so long."
Phoebe, you had a date three days ago.'
That wasn\xc2\x92t a date! That was, that was just friends getting\ntogether\xc2\x85(quietly) having sex.'
Okay. Okay, see? I get the phone.'
No way! No way! You just broke with Tag a week ago.'
Yeah! (Breaking up) And until now, I didn\xc2\x92t think I\xc2\x92d love\nagain.'
Nice try.'
Oh hey-hey wait! How do we fairly decide who gets the phone?'
I don\xc2\x92t know. '
Well umm, maybe we could uhh\xc2\x85 (Grabs the phone) Ah-ha! Too slow!! '
Ah-ha! Too cocky!'
I\xc2\x92m going to keep dating him Mother, and there\xc2\x92s nothing you can\ndo about it!'
Oh yes there is!'
What are you going to do? Kill him? Like you did with Charles?!'
(gasps) That was an accident! And so were you.'
Well, at least I\xc2\x92m not a murderer! (Jessica slaps her.)'
(crying) Oh, my baby! (Hugs Dina, but moves Dina\xc2\x92s head\nto her other shoulder so that she\xc2\x92s the only one in the picture.)'
Cut!'
That was a great scene! And-and-and that slap looks so real! How do you do\nthat?'
Oh, just years of experience.'
(crying) Can I get some ice here?!'
Oh anyway, I just wanted to say how wonderful I think you are.'
You\xc2\x92re not the fan who\xc2\x92s dying are you?'
Say what?'
I\xc2\x92m supposed to meet and hug a fan whose dying, but that\xc2\x92s\nnot supposed to be until (to no one in particular) later!'
No. No, I\xc2\x92m Joey Tribbiani; we did a scene together yesterday.\nI-I\xc2\x92m the guy in the coma!'
Oh that was a real person?!'
An-an-anyway I-I just wanted to say that since I\xc2\x92m getting your brain\nwhen you leave the show, I was wondering if there was any tips you can give me\xc2\x85'
I-I-I\xc2\x92m leaving the show?'
(quickly) I don\xc2\x92t know. Why? Did you hear something?'
Who told you that?'
Oh uh, one of the writers.'
Which one? Was it bald or was it tall?'
Umm\xc2\x85'
Y\xc2\x92know what? It doesn\xc2\x92t matter! Because it is not true!'
Okay.'
And if it were true, how dare you come to me ask me for tips\nabout a character that I\xc2\x92ve been playing for 20 years\xc2\x97I\xc2\x92ll give you a tip!\n(She throws her drink in his face.)'
Ms. Monroe\xc2\x85 (She slaps him) Oh there you go. (She storms off, leaving\nJoey standing next to Dina. They share a nod at the ferocity of the slap they just\nreceived.)'

No Phoebe! You cannot get the phone that way; that\xc2\x92s not fair! Okay
look, I have an idea. Why don\xc2\x92t we, why don\xc2\x92t we see what kind of number he has
on his speed dial, and then from that we can tell who has more in common with him. And
then whoever does gets the phone.'
Or, we can decide by whose ever name is closer to the word phone.'
I don\xc2\x92t think so.'
(handing Rachel the phone) Fine all right, but I\xc2\x92d bet you\xc2\x92d\nbe singing another tune if we were fighting over a ratchet.'
(checking the speed dial) All right, first name on the speed dial is\nmom.'
Ohh, I lost my mom to suicide.'
Okay no way, you cannot use that to get the cute guy and the last\nblueberry muffin.'
Did I use that already today? I\xc2\x92m sorry.'
Yes okay. (Checking the speed dial again.) Well now see this isn\xc2\x92t\ntelling us anything. (Reading the speed dial) Joe. Carlos. Peter. Ooh! Peter Luger! T\nhat\xc2\x92s a steak house!'
Okay, a meat eater. Fine, that\xc2\x92s one for you.'
(looking at the speed dial) Oh, I win! He\xc2\x92s got Barney\xc2\x92s\non his speed dial.'
So you don\xc2\x92t know that\xc2\x92s Barney\xc2\x92s the store! That\ncan be y\xc2\x92know his friend\xc2\x92s house, or a bar. Who has Barney\xc2\x92s the\nstore on their speed dial?'
(showing Phoebe her phone) His new girlfriend!'
What is that?'
I think it\xc2\x92s the dying cat parade.'
It sounds like it\xc2\x92s coming from across the street.'
(turning around and looking) Oh my God!'
What?'
Y\xc2\x92know that thing that Ross was gonna do at our wedding?! He was\nhanging out with me yesterday and he turned to me and said, "You\xc2\x92re half\nScottish right?"'
Nooo!!'
Yes!!'
No, there is no way! It can not be Ross! (She looks through the\nwindow and sees Ross practicing and fumbling around with the pipes.) Unbelievable! Why\nis your family Scottish?!'
Why is your family Ross?!'
He cannot play at our wedding! I mean everyone will leave! I mean come\non, that is just noise! It\xc2\x92s not even a song!'
If you listen very carefully, I think its Celebration by Cool\nand the Gang.'
Hi Pheebs!'
Hi!'
How are ya?'
Good.'
Umm Pheebs, remember when we were in the coffee house we decided that I\nwas going to keep the uh, the cute guy\xc2\x92s cell phone?'
Yeah.'
And remember how I said I was going to keep it in my purse so that if it\nrang I could just pick it up?'
Yeah!'
And do you remember going into my purse and stealing the phone?!'
Ooh, now you lost me.'
You stole the phone!'
No I didn\xc2\x92t!'
No? So you\xc2\x92re saying that if I called it, it wouldn\xc2\x92t ring?'
No.'

Umm, okay. But while you dial, let me show you the features of my new\nringing handbag. (Rachel dials her phone and Phoebe\xc2\x92s bag starts to ring.) Oh, it\ndoes work! (Rachel grabs the phone and takes it out of Phoebe\xc2\x92s handbag.)'
Phoebe!'
That is a different phone.'

Oh is it?! (She answers the cute guy\xc2\x92s phone.) Uhh, hello? (On her\nphone) Yes hi, is Rachel there? (On the other phone) Yes she is, just one moment please.\n(To Phoebe, holding out both phones.) It\xc2\x92s for me!'
That is damning evidence.'

Oh my God! I bet that\xc2\x92s him. My digital fairy tale is about to
begin. I wonder how I should be? Should I be uh (In a sexy voice) Hello? Or should I be
(Happily) Hi! It\xc2\x92s Rach\xc2\x85 (Phoebe knocks the phone out of Rachel\xc2\x92s hand,
catches it, and answers it.) Would you stop doing that?!'
(on phone) Hello? (Listens) Yes, I\xc2\x92m the one who found your phone.'
Phoebe! You can\xc2\x92t do th\xc2\x85'
(To Rachel) Shhh! I\xc2\x92m on a call! (On phone) Umm well yeah, you can\npick it up tonight, say 8
You do know that I will be here when he comes over.'
Oh? And how will you know what time to come over?'
You just said it!'
Oh. Okay, well I-I was kinda hoping that I would just\xc2\x85be alone\ny\xc2\x92know to think about my mom and her suicide.'
Oh Phoebe!'
What?! That\xc2\x92s the first time today!'
Ohh! (Exits.)'
So you like the nachos uh? Myself I\xc2\x92m partial to\xc2\x85'
(interrupting) I\xc2\x92m 16.'
See you in 2003. (She walks away.)'

(walking up) You\xc2\x92re absolutely right they are writing me out of\nthe show. They don\xc2\x92t know exactly when it\xc2\x92s going to happen, but apparently\ngoing to be very soon and that\xc2\x92s it.'
I\xc2\x92m so sorry. Look, if it was up to me you would never leave the\nshow.'
Yeah, thanks.'
No I mean it! I can\xc2\x92t believe they would do this to you! And to your\nfans! I mean they are going to be devastated! Heart broken! They love you so much!'
Oh you\xc2\x92re right. Thank you! What\xc2\x92s your name again?'
Joey.'
Joey, well thank you. That is so sweet. Oh, excuse me. (She throws her\ndrink on a passing writer.)'
It wasn\xc2\x92t my decision!'
(to him) I\xc2\x92m having a conversation here! (To Joey) You were\nsaying?'

Uh yeah-ye-ye-ye-ye-ye\xc2\x97l-l-l-l-l-look the-the-the only reason that I,
that I came up to you before was because well, I\xc2\x92m really nervous about-about being
you. Y\xc2\x92know if you can help me capture the essence of the character. Y\xc2\x92know?
Help me keep Jessica alive. Please?'
All right Joey, I will help you. Not because I-I owe it to this stupid\nshow, but because I owe it to Jessica.'
Oh that\xc2\x92s great! Oh thank you so much!'
You\xc2\x92re so welcome.'
Hey! Now, I\xc2\x92ve been watching some tapes, how\xc2\x92s this? (In a\nBritish accent.) "Jessica Lockhart will never step foot in this place again!\nEver!!"'
Is that supposed to be me?'
Yeah.'
Yeah but Jessica doesn\xc2\x92t have an English accent.'
(shocked) I can do an English accent?! That baby\xc2\x92s going on my\nresume!'
Well, I feel like a snack!'
Do you want some shortbread? Eh that\xc2\x92s Scottish like you are.'
Oh no thanks. I don\xc2\x92t like any thing from my Scottish\nheritage.'
What?!'
Well it\xc2\x92s just my entire family was run out of Scotland\nby\xc2\x85Vikings. Anyway, lots of bad memories. (Makes a few unintelligible noises.)'
Oh well, it sounds to me like your family is ready to uh, rediscover its\nScottish roots.'
No! No-no they\xc2\x92re not. They\xc2\x92re still very angry! But\ny\xc2\x92know Chandler is also half-Swedish. You know what the Swedish people are famous\nfor? Sitting down and being quiet.'
Well yeah-yeah the Scottish history is so much more\xc2\x85'
(interrupting) You can not play bagpipes at the wedding!!'
How did you know about that?!'
We heard you play all the way from your apartment!'
Were you the ones called the cops?!'
That\xc2\x92s not really important right now. What is important is;\nwhile we appreciate the gesture, we just don\xc2\x92t feel bagpipes are appropriate for our\nwedding.'
Why not?'
Because we hate them.'
Come on that\xc2\x92s not fair! I mean you haven\xc2\x92t even heard me play!'
We have heard you play.'

No, you\xc2\x92ve heard my practice. Okay? Just-just give me a chance to
perform for you and then decide whatever you want. And I\xc2\x92m not going to tell you what
song I\xc2\x92m gonna play either. But uh, let\xc2\x92s just say when it\xc2\x92s over I\xc2\x92ll
bet there will be a we bit o\xc2\x92 celebration.'
So, the essence of the character is rooted in her confidence. So, when\nJessica enters a room for instance, she owns everything and every person in that room.\n(Joey is nodding.) You try.'
Okay! (He scurries out the set door and re-enters, extremely impressed)\nAll right!'
No, he already knows that he owns everything in the room! He\xc2\x92s not\nfinding it out for the first time! So, try it again.'
Okay. Okay. (He goes out and comes back in, glaring at everything.)'

Right. He\xc2\x92s not angry at the room either. Try it again, he owns
it! He owns the room. It is his. He owns, owns, owns, owns the room! He owns it!!
(Joey gets a snooty look on his face.) All right, it\xc2\x92s a little weird, but it\xc2\x92s
getting better. (Joey is pleased.) Oh well, I\xc2\x92m gonna miss this woman so much. I
don\xc2\x92t know what I\xc2\x92m going to do! I mean, it\xc2\x92s been 20 years of my life.'

Oh well\xc2\x97Hey-hey! Maybe, maybe uh, maybe this is a good thing.\nY\xc2\x92know? It\xc2\x92ll-it\xc2\x92ll give you a chance to shake things up, play different\ncharacters. You\xc2\x92re so talented.'
I am. I am, but I don\xc2\x92t know you know. An actor of a certain age\nis not that easy.'
Hey that\xc2\x92s not true! Look at uh, look at Angela Lansb\xc2\x97Angelina\nJolie!'
I probably should\xc2\x92ve just left years ago when the offers were\npouring in, but y\xc2\x92know I just got so comfy here! And\xc2\x85 Ohh, I turned down some\namazing work!'
Like-like what?'
Well, let\xc2\x92s just say if I left 15 years ago, the landscape of\nMexican cinema would be very different today!'
(impressed) Wow!'
But\xc2\x85 Well now, now\xc2\x92s a different time for me. (Starts to\ncry.)'

Oh hey come on, don\xc2\x92t-don\xc2\x92t-don\xc2\x92t do this! Umm, look
let-let me tell you something, okay? Now when I watch you do a scene, I\xc2\x92m thinking,
"Boy, she-she is a great actress!" (She\xc2\x92s not buying it.) Uh but-but, I am
also thinking, "She is hot!"'
(intrigued) You think I\xc2\x92m hot?'
You own the room. (She smiles and stares longingly into his eyes.) We\nshould probably get-get uh\xc2\x85'
Oh yeah-yeah, we should get the\xc2\x85 (Pause) So when Jessica kisses a\nman, she usually puts umm, both her hands on the man\xc2\x92s face. (She does so.)'
Yeah-yeah, I noticed that! Is that \xc2\x91cause she\xc2\x92s so passionate?'
No! It\xc2\x92s because that way the camera only sees her! (She takes her\nhands off his face.) Do you wanna try it?'
Yeah! Okay. (He puts his hands on her face and they kiss.)'

That was good, that was really good. But I-I think your hands maybe a\nlittle off, they should be maybe right like\xc2\x85 (She grabs the back of his neck and\nkisses him passionately causing them to fall onto the couch.)'
Hey! Hey!'
(simultaneously) Who is it?'
Whoa! Why do you get to answer the door?'
Well why shouldn\xc2\x92t I?!'
Because it\xc2\x92s my apartment!'
Well, then I get to give him the cell phone.'
Okay. All right. (Hands her the phone.) Good luck explaining all the\ncalls to China.'
Hi!'
(To Rachel) Wow! How long were we arguing for?'
(laughs) You\xc2\x92re not the man who left the cell phone.'
No that\xc2\x92s my assistant.'
Is-is he coming? (Looks hopefully out the door.)'
Umm, no.'
Could you-could you umm, give us one second?'
Sure!'
We\xc2\x92ll be right back sir.'
Sure.'
Wh-what do we do?'
I don\xc2\x92t know!'
Can you believe this? (Rachel exhales in amazement.) We were waiting for\na hot guy and then an even hotter one shows up!'
I know! (Realizes what Phoebe said.) What?!'
Hmm, they just don\xc2\x92t make \xc2\x91em like that anymore!'
(turning and looking at Tom again) No-no they do but, you just have to\nwait.'
Rachel, listen\xc2\x97I mean, if you let me have him then I will really\nowe you one.'
(fake disappointment) All right. All right Phoebe I will let you have\nhim, but you owe me; you owe me big!'
Yeah! You\xc2\x92re such a great friend!'
Ohh\xc2\x85'
So, which one of you lovely ladies am I going to take to dinner huh?'
Oh that\xc2\x92d be me. Sir. (Hands him the cell phone.) After you.'
Okay. Okay. (Exits and Phoebe checks him out.)'
(whispering) Nice!'
Well, you certainly own that room.'
Actually I rent the whole place and, I just got what you meant. Thank you.'
Hi.'
Hey!'
Oh my God! Oh my God!! Ohh, Jessica Lockhart!! In my apartment!! I am\nsuch a huge fan! I am such a huge fan!'
Well, it\xc2\x92s nice to know that you\xc2\x85'
(screaming) MONICA!!!! MONICA!!!! (Runs to Monica\xc2\x92s.)'
That uh, that is my roommate Rachel.'
Oh that explains all the women\xc2\x92s underwear.'
(shrugs) Sure. Yep.'
(entering with Rachel) Oh my God! It\xc2\x92s true!! Oh my God you are so\namazing! Oh my God, can I just ask you to do me oh, just one favor?'
Certainly.'
Would you slap me? Would you slap me right here in the face?! (Points to\nher cheek.)'
I\xc2\x92d love to, but my lawyer said I can\xc2\x92t do that anymore.'
God. You seem really, really nice.'
Okay, bye-bye.'
I mean n-not-not fake at all like most famous people.'
All right, here we go. (He grabs them and starts to pull them out of the\napartment.)'
Okay.'
(breaks away) Oh wait, just one more thing! One more minute! (To\nCecilia) Umm, you\xc2\x92re a stupid bitch.'
I really can\xc2\x92t slap you. (Monica walks away angrily)'
You are so beautiful.'
Nice to meet you! My God you\xc2\x92re great!'
Thanks for stopping by. See ya! (Throws them out and closes the door.) (To\nCecilia) I-I am so sorry. I\xc2\x85'
Oh no-no-no-no, being adored. I\xc2\x92m used to it, don\xc2\x92t worry\nabout it.'
(notices something in the mail that Rachel brought in) Oh my God!'
What?'
They sent me today\xc2\x92s script! They never send the script!'
They don\xc2\x92t?'
Well no, I\xc2\x92m just in a coma. This must mean I have lines! (Realizes\nwhat that means.) Oh\xc2\x85'
How does it happen?'
(flipping to the last page) Ew, you get thrown from a horse into an\nelectric fence.'
Ah what?! Jessica hates horses!'
Yeah well, I\xc2\x92m guessing after this she\xc2\x92s not going to be crazy\nabout electricity either.'
\xc2\x85now remember you have to imagine me in a kilt.'
(giggles) (To Ross) I can imagine you in a short plaid skirt and knee\nsocks.'
(To Rachel) Do you wanna start telling secrets?'
No!'
(stands up) Now umm, remember I\xc2\x92m still learning.'
One, two, three, four!'
You know the song! Sing along!'
So?'
No!'
Loosening the saddle on mother\xc2\x92s horse was brilliant Fredrick. And\nthe electric fence, inspired.'
Thank you sweetheart. (They clink glasses.)'

I can\xc2\x92t believe she\xc2\x92s really gone. Look around you, all of this\nis ours. (They move into kiss but; they\xc2\x92re stopped by Joey entering with a huge\nbandage wrapped around his head.)'
(as Jessica) I don\xc2\x92t think so.'
Who are you?!'
What\xc2\x92s the matter Dina? Don\xc2\x92t you recognize your own\n(Does a hair flip) mother?!'
(running out to Joey) That was so wonderful! (Hugs him) Ohh, I think\nthat you\xc2\x92re a better Jessica than I ever was!'
Oh noo\xc2\x85'
Well of course not, but you were very good.'
Thanks!'
And guess what? Good news! I got another job!'
Great! Hey! All right! Well-well what is it?!'
A film in Guadalajara!'
The airport?'
No that\xc2\x92s La Guardia. (Joey nods in recognition.) This is Mexico.'
Ohh. Wow! Well how-how, how will you be gone?'
Eight months.'
That\xc2\x92s a really long time.'
Yeah, but you can come and visit me. I bet that you could uh, own a few\nplaces down there.'
Well I tell ya, I should probably buy a place in the city first.\n(Realizes.) And I just got what you meant again\xc2\x97That is\xc2\x97I tell ya, that is a\ntricky one!'
That is a tricky one. Well, Joey I really wanna thank you. You\xc2\x92ve,\nwell you made a very difficult time for me a little less painful.'
Good luck.'
You too.'
You know the song! Sing along!'
Eeee!!! Eee!! Eee!! '
Eee!! (This causes more laughter.)'
Do it again!'
